title: Impulse-Momentum Theorem
text: The impulse-momentum theorem states $$F_{avg} \Delta t=m \Delta v$$, where:F_avg is the average force, Δt is the time the force is applied, $$m$$ is the mass of the object, Δv is the change in velocity.

title: Plug in and Solve for $$F_{avg}$$
text: What is $$F_{avg}=\frac{m \Delta v}{\Delta t}=\frac{\frac{0.5kg\times20 m}{s}}{20} ms$$ in Newton?(remember to first convert ms to s, 1ms=1*10**-3s)
